Package com.facetec.sdk

Class FaceTecIDScanCustomization

java.lang.Object
com.facetec.sdk.FaceTecIDScanCustomization
public final class FaceTecIDScanCustomization extends Object
Customize the Photo ID Match Screens.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    int
    activeTorchButtonImage
    Image displayed for the Torch button on the Identity Document Capture Screen when the torch/flashlight is active/on.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_active_torch' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    int
    additionalReviewScreenAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the ID Scan Additional Review Screen.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewScreenAnimationDisplayTime API.
    double
    additionalReviewScreenAnimationDisplayTime
    Controls the length of time to display the Additional Review Screen animation after being transitioned in and before being transitioned out.
    Value is in seconds.
    int
    additionalReviewScreenBackgroundColors
    Color of the Additional Review Screen background.
    This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
    Default is white.
    int
    additionalReviewScreenForegroundColor
    Color of the text displayed on the Additional Review Screen (not including the action button text).
    Default is custom color.
    int
    additionalReviewScreenImage
    Image displayed on the ID Scan Additional Review Screen.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_review' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    If no image is configured and FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewScreenAnimation is set to 0, a default animation will be used.
    int
    additionalReviewTagImage
    Image displayed for the Additional Review Tag during the ID Scan Result Screen, if additional review is required.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_review_tag' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    If a custom image is not configured, default image displayed will use the color specified by FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewTagImageColor.
    int
    additionalReviewTagImageColor
    Color of the default Additional Review Tag image.
    Only is applied to the Additional Review Tag image if FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewTagImage is set to 0.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    additionalReviewTagTextColor
    Color of the Additional Review Tag text.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    buttonBackgroundDisabledColor
    Color of the action button's background when the button is disabled during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    buttonBackgroundHighlightColor
    Color of the action button's background when the button is pressed during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    buttonBackgroundNormalColor
    Color of the action button's background during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    buttonBorderColor
    Color of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is transparent.
    int
    buttonBorderWidth
    Thickness of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
    int
    buttonCornerRadius
    Corner radius of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
    android.graphics.Typeface
    buttonFont
    Font of the action button's text during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    If this value is null, FaceTec's default Typeface will be used.
    int
    buttonTextDisabledColor
    Color of the action button's text when the button is disabled during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is white.
    int
    buttonTextHighlightColor
    Color of the action button's text when the button is pressed during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is white.
    int
    buttonTextNormalColor
    Color of the action button's text during the Photo ID Match Screens.
    Default is white.
    int
    captureFrameCornerRadius
    Corner radius of the Identity Document Capture Frame.
    This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
    int
    captureFrameStrokeColor
    Color of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    captureFrameStrokeWidth
    Thickness of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
    This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
    int
    captureScreenBackgroundColor
    Color of the Identity Document Capture Screen's background.
    Default is white.
    android.graphics.Typeface
    captureScreenFocusMessageFont
    Font of the tap-to-focus message text below the Capture Frame during the Identity Document Capture Screen.
    If this value is null, FaceTec's default Typeface will be used.
    int
    captureScreenFocusMessageTextColor
    Color of the tap-to-focus message text displayed below the Capture Frame during the Identity Document Capture Screen.
    Default is off-black.
    int
    captureScreenForegroundColor
    Color of the text displayed on the Identity Document Capture Screen (not including the action button text or the tap-to-focus message text).
    Default is white.
    int
    captureScreenTextBackgroundBorderColor
    Color of the text view background border during the Identity Document Capture Screen.
    Default is transparent.
    int
    captureScreenTextBackgroundBorderWidth
    Thickness of the text view background border during the Identity Document Capture Screen.
    Default is 0.
    int
    captureScreenTextBackgroundColor
    Color of the text view background during the Identity Document Capture Screen.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    captureScreenTextBackgroundCornerRadius
    Corner radius of the text view background and border during the Identity Document Capture Screen.
    Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.
    int
    customNFCCardScanningAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation while the user scans their NFC card chip.
    This is similar to customNFCScanningAnimation, which is used for Passport books instead of Passport/NFC cards Default is 0.
    int
    customNFCCardStartingAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation before the user starts to scan their NFC card chip.
    This is similar to customNFCStartingAnimation, which is used for Passport books instead of Passport/NFC cards Default is 0.
    int
    customNFCScanningAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation while the user scan's their NFC chip.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: The NFC Scanning animation is displayed indefinitely during the device-side work to scan the NFC chip, so the custom animation should be set to loop/repeat infinitely.
    int
    customNFCSkipOrErrorAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation after NFC Scan is skipped due to an error or user interaction.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.nfcScreenAnimationDisplayTime API.
    int
    customNFCStartingAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation before the user starts to scan their NFC chip.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: The NFC Starting animation is displayed indefinitely during the device-side work to scan the NFC chip, so the custom animation should be set to loop/repeat infinitely.
    boolean
    disableAdditionalReviewScreen
    Controls whether to show the Additional Review Screen at the end of an ID Scan Session if there was an issue with scanning part of the ID.
    Default is false (shown).
    boolean
    disableIDFeedbackScreen
    Controls whether to show the ID Scan Feedback Screen at the end of an ID Scan Result Screen if there was a correctable issue with scanning the ID.
    Default is false (shown).
    boolean
    enableAdditionalReviewTag
    Display the Additional Review Tag during the ID Scan Result Screen, if additional review is required.
    This tag will not be displayed if the Additional Review Screen is disabled.
    Default is true.
    int
    faceMatchToIDBrandingImage
    Image displayed on the ID Scan Capture Screen for Face Match To ID Sessions.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_face_match_to_id_branding_logo' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    android.graphics.Typeface
    headerFont
    Font of the title during the Identity Document Type Selection Screen.
    If this value is null, FaceTec's default Typeface will be used.
    double
    idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime
    Controls the length of time to display the ID Feedback Screen animation after being transitioned in and before being transitioned out.
    Value is in seconds.
    int
    idFeedbackScreenBackgroundColors
    Color of the ID Feedback Screen background.
    This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
    Default is white.
    int
    idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage
    Image displayed on the ID Scan Feedback Screen for the back-side of the ID in the default animation.
    The images configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage and idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage will be used for the default flip animation and displayed instead of a custom animation configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation or idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_id_card_back' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    int
    idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage
    Image displayed on the ID Scan Feedback Screen for the front-side of the ID in the default animation.
    The images configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage and idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage will be used for the default flip animation and displayed instead of a custom animation configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation or idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_id_card_front' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    int
    idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the ID Scan Feedback Screen when presenting an ID front-side for an ID back-side capture, or when progressing from the front-side capture to the back-side capture.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime API.
    int
    idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation
    Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the ID Scan Feedback Screen when presenting an ID back-side for an ID front-side capture.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime API.
    int
    idFeedbackScreenForegroundColor
    Color of the text displayed on the ID Feedback Screen.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    inactiveTorchButtonImage
    Image displayed for the Torch button on the Identity Document Capture Screen when the torch/flashlight is inactive/off.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_inactive_torch' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    double
    nfcScreenAnimationDisplayTime
    Controls the length of time to display the NFC Screen animation after being transitioned in and before being transitioned out.
    Value is in seconds.
    int
    reviewScreenBackgroundColors
    Color of the Identity Document Review Screen background.
    This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
    Default is white.
    int
    reviewScreenForegroundColor
    Color of the text displayed on the Identity Document Review Screen (not including the action button text).
    Default is white.
    int
    reviewScreenTextBackgroundBorderColor
    Color of the text view background border during the Identity Document Review Screen.
    Default is transparent.
    int
    reviewScreenTextBackgroundBorderWidth
    Thickness of the text view background border during the Identity Document Review Screen.
    This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
    int
    reviewScreenTextBackgroundColor
    Color of the text view background during the Identity Document Review Screen.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    reviewScreenTextBackgroundCornerRadius
    Corner radius of the text view background and border during the Identity Document Review Screen.
    This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
    int
    selectionScreenBackgroundColors
    Color of the Identity Document Type Selection Screen background.
    This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
    Default is white.
    int
    selectionScreenDocumentImage
    Image displayed on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen below the header message.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_document' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    int
    selectionScreenForegroundColor
    Color of the text displayed on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen (not including the action button text).
    Default is custom color.
    boolean
    showFaceMatchToIDBrandingImage
    Controls whether to show the 'facetec_face_match_to_id_branding_logo' image (or image configured with .faceMatchToIDBrandingImage) on the ID Scan Capture Screen for Face Match to ID Sessions.
    boolean
    showSelectionScreenDocumentImage
    Controls whether to show the 'facetec_document' image (or image configured with .selectionScreenDocumentImage) on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen.
    int
    standaloneIDScanWatermark
    Image displayed on the ID Scan Capture Screen for standalone ID Scan Sessions.
    Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_standalone_id_scan_watermark' located in application's res/drawable folder.
    android.graphics.Typeface
    subtextFont
    Font of the instruction message text during the Identity Document Capture and Review Screens.
    If this value is null, FaceTec's default Typeface will be used.

  • Field Details

    • showSelectionScreenDocumentImage

      public boolean showSelectionScreenDocumentImage
      Controls whether to show the 'facetec_document' image (or image configured with .selectionScreenDocumentImage) on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen.
      Default is true (visible).

    • selectionScreenDocumentImage

      @DrawableRes public int selectionScreenDocumentImage
      Image displayed on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen below the header message.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_document' located in application's res/drawable folder.

    • captureScreenBackgroundColor

      public int captureScreenBackgroundColor
      Color of the Identity Document Capture Screen's background.
      Default is white.

    • captureFrameStrokeColor

      public int captureFrameStrokeColor
      Color of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
      Default is custom color.

    • captureFrameStrokeWidth

      public int captureFrameStrokeWidth
      Thickness of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
      Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

    • captureFrameCornerRadius

      public int captureFrameCornerRadius
      Corner radius of the Identity Document Capture Frame.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
      Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

    • buttonCornerRadius

      public int buttonCornerRadius
      Corner radius of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
      Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

    • customNFCStartingAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int customNFCStartingAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation before the user starts to scan their NFC chip.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: The NFC Starting animation is displayed indefinitely during the device-side work to scan the NFC chip, so the custom animation should be set to loop/repeat infinitely. If the animation ends before the NFC Starting animation is dismissed, the animation will be restarted.
      If this is 0, an internal static image will be used.
      Default is 0.

    • customNFCScanningAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int customNFCScanningAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation while the user scan's their NFC chip.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: The NFC Scanning animation is displayed indefinitely during the device-side work to scan the NFC chip, so the custom animation should be set to loop/repeat infinitely. If the animation ends before the NFC Scanning animation is dismissed, the animation will be restarted.
      If this is 0, an internal static image will be used.
      Default is 0.

    • customNFCCardStartingAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int customNFCCardStartingAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation before the user starts to scan their NFC card chip.
      This is similar to customNFCStartingAnimation, which is used for Passport books instead of Passport/NFC cards Default is 0.

    • customNFCCardScanningAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int customNFCCardScanningAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation while the user scans their NFC card chip.
      This is similar to customNFCScanningAnimation, which is used for Passport books instead of Passport/NFC cards Default is 0.

    • customNFCSkipOrErrorAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int customNFCSkipOrErrorAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the NFC Scan Screen for the status animation after NFC Scan is skipped due to an error or user interaction.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.nfcScreenAnimationDisplayTime API. Custom animation timing should be configured accordingly.
      If this is 0, an internal static image will be used.
      Default is 0.

    • enableAdditionalReviewTag

      public boolean enableAdditionalReviewTag
      Display the Additional Review Tag during the ID Scan Result Screen, if additional review is required.
      This tag will not be displayed if the Additional Review Screen is disabled.
      Default is true.

    • additionalReviewTagImage

      @DrawableRes public int additionalReviewTagImage
      Image displayed for the Additional Review Tag during the ID Scan Result Screen, if additional review is required.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_review_tag' located in application's res/drawable folder.
      If a custom image is not configured, default image displayed will use the color specified by FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewTagImageColor.

    • additionalReviewTagImageColor

      public int additionalReviewTagImageColor
      Color of the default Additional Review Tag image.
      Only is applied to the Additional Review Tag image if FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewTagImage is set to 0.
      Default is custom color.

    • additionalReviewTagTextColor

      public int additionalReviewTagTextColor
      Color of the Additional Review Tag text.
      Default is custom color.

    • additionalReviewScreenBackgroundColors

      public int additionalReviewScreenBackgroundColors
      Color of the Additional Review Screen background.
      This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
      Default is white.

    • additionalReviewScreenForegroundColor

      public int additionalReviewScreenForegroundColor
      Color of the text displayed on the Additional Review Screen (not including the action button text).
      Default is custom color.

    • additionalReviewScreenImage

      @DrawableRes public int additionalReviewScreenImage
      Image displayed on the ID Scan Additional Review Screen.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_review' located in application's res/drawable folder.
      If no image is configured and FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewScreenAnimation is set to 0, a default animation will be used.

    • additionalReviewScreenAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int additionalReviewScreenAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the ID Scan Additional Review Screen.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewScreenAnimationDisplayTime API. Custom animation timing should be configured accordingly.
      If this is set to an animated vector drawable resource id, the drawable supplied will be used instead of the image configured with FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewScreenImage.
      If this is 0 and FaceTecIDScanCustomization.additionalReviewScreenImage is not configured, a default animation will be displayed instead. The default animation will be colored using FaceTeResultScreenCustomization.resultAnimationUnsuccessBackgroundColor and FaceTeResultScreenCustomization.resultAnimationUnsuccessForegroundColor.
      Default is 0.

    • idFeedbackScreenBackgroundColors

      public int idFeedbackScreenBackgroundColors
      Color of the ID Feedback Screen background.
      This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
      Default is white.

    • idFeedbackScreenForegroundColor

      public int idFeedbackScreenForegroundColor
      Color of the text displayed on the ID Feedback Screen.
      Default is custom color.

    • idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the ID Scan Feedback Screen when presenting an ID front-side for an ID back-side capture, or when progressing from the front-side capture to the back-side capture.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime API. Custom animation timing should be configured accordingly.
      If this is 0, the default animation will be used.
      Default is 0.

    • idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation

      @DrawableRes public int idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation
      Configure an animated vector drawable to display on the ID Scan Feedback Screen when presenting an ID back-side for an ID front-side capture.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: By default, the animation is displayed for 2 seconds, but can be configured within a range using the FaceTecIDScanCustomization.idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime API. Custom animation timing should be configured accordingly.
      If this is 0, the default animation will be used.
      Default is 0.

    • idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage

      @DrawableRes public int idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage
      Image displayed on the ID Scan Feedback Screen for the front-side of the ID in the default animation.
      The images configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage and idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage will be used for the default flip animation and displayed instead of a custom animation configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation or idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_id_card_front' located in application's res/drawable folder.

    • idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage

      @DrawableRes public int idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage
      Image displayed on the ID Scan Feedback Screen for the back-side of the ID in the default animation.
      The images configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDFrontImage and idFeedbackScreenFlipIDBackImage will be used for the default flip animation and displayed instead of a custom animation configured with idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToBackAnimation or idFeedbackScreenFlipIDToFrontAnimation.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_id_card_back' located in application's res/drawable folder.

    • showFaceMatchToIDBrandingImage

      public boolean showFaceMatchToIDBrandingImage
      Controls whether to show the 'facetec_face_match_to_id_branding_logo' image (or image configured with .faceMatchToIDBrandingImage) on the ID Scan Capture Screen for Face Match to ID Sessions.
      Default is false (hidden).

    • faceMatchToIDBrandingImage

      @DrawableRes public int faceMatchToIDBrandingImage
      Image displayed on the ID Scan Capture Screen for Face Match To ID Sessions.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_face_match_to_id_branding_logo' located in application's res/drawable folder.

    • standaloneIDScanWatermark

      @DrawableRes public int standaloneIDScanWatermark
      Image displayed on the ID Scan Capture Screen for standalone ID Scan Sessions.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_standalone_id_scan_watermark' located in application's res/drawable folder.

    • disableAdditionalReviewScreen

      public boolean disableAdditionalReviewScreen
      Controls whether to show the Additional Review Screen at the end of an ID Scan Session if there was an issue with scanning part of the ID.
      Default is false (shown).

    • disableIDFeedbackScreen

      public boolean disableIDFeedbackScreen
      Controls whether to show the ID Scan Feedback Screen at the end of an ID Scan Result Screen if there was a correctable issue with scanning the ID.
      Default is false (shown).

    • additionalReviewScreenAnimationDisplayTime

      public double additionalReviewScreenAnimationDisplayTime
      Controls the length of time to display the Additional Review Screen animation after being transitioned in and before being transitioned out.
      Value is in seconds. This value has to be between 1.5 and 3.0. If its lower than 1.5 or higher than 3.0, it will be defaulted to 1.5 or 3.0 respectively.
      Default is 2 (seconds).

    • idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime

      public double idFeedbackScreenAnimationDisplayTime
      Controls the length of time to display the ID Feedback Screen animation after being transitioned in and before being transitioned out.
      Value is in seconds. This value has to be between 1.5 and 3.0. If its lower than 1.5 or higher than 3.0, it will be defaulted to 1.5 or 3.0 respectively.
      Default is 2 (seconds).

    • nfcScreenAnimationDisplayTime

      public double nfcScreenAnimationDisplayTime
      Controls the length of time to display the NFC Screen animation after being transitioned in and before being transitioned out.
      Value is in seconds. This value has to be between 1.5 and 3.0. If its lower than 1.5 or higher than 3.0, it will be defaulted to 1.5 or 3.0 respectively.
      Default is 2 (seconds).

  • Constructor Details

    • FaceTecIDScanCustomization

      public FaceTecIDScanCustomization()
      Constructor for FaceTecIDScanCustomization object.
